reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Very comfortable b&b. I was a bit surprised to find the family rooms on the top floor (expected them on the ground floor for some reason) but the suite was comfortable and thoughtfully arranged. Our 14 year old daughter was delighted with her room and the claw foot bath in the bathroom. Our room was very spacious with a sea view which was unexpected. The breakfast on the Monday morning was delicious although it lost a little of the personal touch when we had to serve ourselves tea and coffee from the pots on the sideboard, along with jam etc. from large dishes rather than individual pots on the tables. However, the food was tasty and well cooked. All in all a good find!
reviews.title: Very comfortable with everything we needed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a lovely stay here for 3 nights. On arrival we were shown to our room (Room 1) which is on the ground floor. It was a spacious double, overlooking the well-kept gardens. It had modern furniture, LCD/DVD combo and tea and coffee making facilities. The en-suite bathroom was huge with a modern shower enclosure and electric shower. It could easily have accommodated a bath which would have been welcome. For me, the bed could have benefited from being deeper and firmer. The odd thing about the room was that one could hear the sound of the occupants in the room above. Nothing major, but on our last night the occupant above was snoring quite loudly! At breakfast one helped oneself to fruit juice, a choice of cereals, fresh fruit (Strawberries and Melon), together with filter coffee and a choice of teas, whilst awaiting the excellent cooked breakfast with locally sourced produce. The hotel is well placed for a short stroll into picturesque Bull Bay (one pub, a tearoom, and a few houses) or a shor drive into Cemaes Bay with a choice of pubs/eateries, a picturesque harbour and a lovely beach. For walkers there are a number of circular walks nearby and the hotel has drying facilities and storage facilities for bikes. The owners are extremely pleasant and helpful. All in all a very good stay.
reviews.title: Lovely Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned today from 2 nights at Rhianfa. Stayed in Rm 1, Good sized double room witha large bathromm. We took our dog with us who sleeps in a large crate at night. There was plenty of room even with the crate. Plenty of information on what to do & where to go, we went for the coastal walks, plenty of literature for the walks in reception. There's a very large garden with swings & tyres for kids to play on, also tables & chairs to sit out at if the weather is good.
reviews.title: Lovely Bed & Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate twice at The Bull Bay Hotel, one evening meal in the restaurant & one snack in the bar, both nights good food & good value for money. We also had a meal in The Trescastel Hotel. Lovely views from the large conservatory dining room overlooking the sea toward Ireland. There's also a large decked area outside & a large play area for kids.
reviews.title: As nice as it looks!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Difficult to fault. We were given, what I assume, is the family room at the top of the house: 3 rooms + bathroom; 3 TVs (we only managed to use 2 at any one time); well-equipped throughout; friendly; excellent food; great location except (and this is not the B&B's fault but seems to be general in Wales), you have to drive to get an evening meal (we found the local pub to be cavernous, cold and rather unfriendly). Try 'Little Italy' in Amlwch but beware what you order; the pizzas are too big for any mortal to consume at one sitting (they will box the remains up for you and they taste almost as good the next day when you're sitting watching the tide coming in!
reviews.title: Excellent B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: This B&B was brilliant, the cleanest, most comfortable of any B&B that I have stayed in. It would beat any 5star hotel. The breakfast was just delicious. The family room was so spacious. Just brilliant. From Carol
reviews.title: Fantastic and so peaceful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed here with my 12 week old daughter and my mother in the family room, number 6. It was spotless, and it was more like an apartment with two rooms, then just a family room. The couple running it, Michael and Sian, we're very courteous, and the breakfast was great. Hands down it is the best b and b I have stayed in. My self and my mother are very picky about cleanliness in hotels etc, and this by far excelled expectations. The grounds are lovely and peaceful also. Wish we could have stayed longer!
reviews.title: Excellent B&B on Anglesey

reviews.title: weekend stay

aka: Rhianfa Amlwch, Wales - Island Of Anglesey
description: Rhianfa is a quiet and friendly family run establishment on the outskirts of the beautiful seaside village of Bull Bay. The property itself sits in 1 acre of land and is surrounded by fields and trees and is 300 yards walk away from the beach.
